• The bias stems from how the models are trained and the data they see, not just from missing samples

bullets: • Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton is encouraging the public to help enforce the state’s “bathroom bill” via a tip line
• Senate Bill 8 requires government buildings, schools and colleges to restrict access to restrooms and locker rooms based on sex assigned at birth
• If someone enters the “wrong” bathroom, institutions, not the individual, are punished by the state

items.title: This tiny protein helps control how hungry you feel
bullets: • Researchers have identified a previously overlooked protein that helps regulate appetite and energy use in the body
• This protein supports a key system that decides whether the body burns energy or stores it, and when it does not function properly, appetite signals can weaken
• Discovery could help scientists better understand how genetic factors contribute to obesity

items.title: Physicists 3D-printed a Christmas tree of ice
bullets: • A 3D-printed Christmas tree is made of ice without refrigeration or other freezing technology
• The trick was to house the 3D printing inside a vacuum chamber using a jet nozzle as the printing
• Evaporative cooling is a well-known phenomenon; mammals use it to regulate body temperature
• It's also the main culprit behind the infamous “stall” that so frequently plagues aspiring BBQ pit masters

items.title: Scientists log rare case of female polar bear adopting cub: ‘They’re really good moms’
bullets: • Scientists in Canada have documented a rare case of female polar bear adopting a new cub
• The adoption is only the 13th ever witnessed in the population
• The mother and the cubs are part of the Western Hudson Bay polar bear subpopulation, which is among the most studied in the world

• Alyssa Tapley, 13, was the first in the world to receive the treatment, known as BE-CAR7
